com.pokerface.pokerapi.game

Class GameService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pokerface.pokerapi.game.GameService

  • @Service
public class GameService
extends java.lang.Object
    GameService is the heart of the logic of the Back End. It communicates solely with the Controller, it handles GameIds and GameAction's to modify the gameState and create and then return Transport objects which are then communicated with the Front End users. It uses a GameRepository which is where it loads and saves GameStates and the changes it has made to them.

    • Method Detail

      • getGameState

        public GameStateTransport getGameState(long gameID)
        This gets a gamestate transport object for the client when they first join or need it, requiring only the id
        Parameters:
        gameID - is the representative of the gamestate in the database
        Returns:
        the object for communication to the frontend

      • handleAction

        public GameStateTransport handleAction(long gameID,
                                       GameAction action,
                                       int playerID)
        This method takes the message from the Controller when an action is received, it takes that action, interprets it, gets the gamestate and calls appropriate methods. It also grabs the player reference at the table matching the id and sends it along. After this is completed handleAction then sets that players last action, and advances to the next player.
        Parameters:
        gameID - represenative of the gamestate in the database
        action - the action being performed
        playerID - the playerID who the action is handling, where they sit
        Returns:
        GameUpdateTransport an update for the user to maintain their gamestate

      • bet

        public boolean bet(GameState gameState,
                   GameAction action,
                   Player player)
        This method handles bet/raise actions applying a bet
        Parameters:
        gameState - the state of the game grabbed by repository via ID
        action - the action being performed, interpreted already
        player - the user who performed the action
        Returns:
        boolean representing if it went through successfully

        public boolean check(GameState gameState,
                     GameAction action,
                     Player player)
        check is the method to apply a users check action to the gamestate in question
        Parameters:
        gameState - the current state of the game being played
        action - the action being applied
        player - the player who is performing the action
        Returns:
        boolean representing if it went through successfully

                    Player player)
        fold allows the user to fold, surrendering the hand in question
        Parameters:
        gameState - gameState where the user is folding
        action - the data of the fold
        player - is the one who is folding
        Returns:
        boolean representing if it went through successfully

      • isRoundEnd

        public boolean isRoundEnd(long gameID)
        isRoundEnd checks if the game is at the end of the round, this chains to the actual call by getting the game first
        Parameters:
        gameID - the ID of the game being checked
        Returns:
        a chained boolean of if the round has ended

      • isRoundEnd

        public boolean isRoundEnd(GameState gameState)
        isRoundEnd returns a boolean value if the Round, the first or second, is at its end as betting has ceased.
        Parameters:
        gameState - of the game being checked
        Returns:
        boolean representing if the round is ended

      • isHandEnd

        public boolean isHandEnd(long gameID)
        isHandEnd is a chain called to isHandEnd with the gameState. THis grabs the gamestate
        Parameters:
        gameID - the game being grabbed
        Returns:
        boolean return of chain call

      • isHandEnd

        public boolean isHandEnd(GameState gameState)
        isHandEnd checks if a hand has ended, has everyone but one player folded, or are we at the showdown?
        Parameters:
        gameState - the game being checked
        Returns:
        boolean value representing if the game hand has ended

      • matchmake

        public long matchmake(long playerID)
        This method takes a player's ID and finds a game for them. THe logic for this can be improved as matchmaking algorithms are made more complex.
        Parameters:
        playerID - the playerID needing to be added to a game
        Returns:
        the long id of the game they will join
